Well, I'm around for quite a while and don't remember the devs ever saying that they would not add reentry effects, period. In fact the game since 0.14 is ready to have reentry effects, just with all the parts completely immune to it up until now ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) Also, Squad already made some experimentals long long time ago with clouds ( 0.14 again, maybe? ), so if they add clouds I would not give the full credits to modders ...

I was quoting a quote from the wiki around the time of .19 or .20 (I started playing in .19 so I'm not an old timer but I have played for awhile)

> 
> Is it me or have the devs started just making popular mods actual features as a main strategy
> Gosh how many years ago was it stated that Reentry effects will never be in the base game?
> 
> Also now they've dot RoverDude doing official models and following on to the environmental mods with clouds and new plane parts
> 
> What's next BDArmory?
> 
> Yes please

No thanks to BDArmory, but as far as Squad implementing features similar to mods, well, the game has been out for a long time. If there's not a mod for [insert feature] yet, I'd be really surprised.

Besides the lack of fuel tanks/doughnuts/springs, I have another issue. I build planes a lot now, and I have to say, I'm disappointed by the lack of a pointy nosecone. Yeah, sure, we have the pointy one which went with the old Mk3 cockpit, but I think that needs to be re-textured. And the small cone which you put on the front? That's too round for my high speed designs. I have taken to offsetting and rotating ALL THREE Communotrons to get the shape I want. Which really racks up the part count.

So, my suggestion to Squad: add more nosecones! I'm thinking 5:

1. The old blue and white one

2. A 1.25 version of the C7 adapter (the one with LFO)

3. A 1.25 of the other C7 adapter (the slanted one)

4. A conical 1.25 nosecone- think the one we have now with a pointy end

5. An offset conical 1.25 nosecone- think smaller slanted C7 adapter.
Now we're talking about feature creep. Squad has to draw a line in the sand somewhere.

> 
> I was quoting a quote from the wiki around the time of .19 or .20 (I started playing in .19 so I'm not an old timer but I have played for awhile)

Then the wiki was wrong, the devs were already discussing reentry heat during the development of 0.19. Given that the wiki is maintained by users interpreting what Squad said in various places, that's not too surprising. Squad has also been known to change their minds, so it's not impossible that they had made a no-reentry-heat statement prior to that, but changed their minds. I can't even definitively say that between their pro-reentry-heat comments at that time and the current comments that squad hadn't changed their minds. There did appear to be some waffling a while back.

> 
> So, my suggestion to Squad: add more nosecones! I'm thinking 5:
> 
> 1. The old blue and white one
> 
> 2. A 1.25 version of the C7 adapter (the one with LFO)
> 
> 3. A 1.25 of the other C7 adapter (the slanted one)
> 
> 4. A conical 1.25 nosecone- think the one we have now with a pointy end
> 
> 5. An offset conical 1.25 nosecone- think smaller slanted C7 adapter.

While I fully agree with you, I'm hopeful that with the procedural fairings coming up in 0.27, we'll be able to design our own nosecones (depending on the mechanics).

At this rate squad should delete all parts altogether as part of the stock release and let users fill their installs with mod parts.

This post is hyperbole.
